ENTRY.refkeywords: profile circular elliptical radial ellipse plot plotting resid residual residuals pref preference preferences
ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: The plot preferences for radial or elliptical profiles of the residuals (data - model) to imaging data.

DESC.PARA: The get_resid_prof_prefs() command returns the preferences for the residuals in plots created by the prof_resid() and prof_fit_resid() commands. Changing the values will not change existing plots, only new plots created after the change was made. For example
will cause any new plots to use logarithmic scaling for the X axis. A list of all the preferences is given below.
The routine can be loaded into Sherpa by saying:
The following table lists the allowed keys and values for the object returned by get_resid_prof_prefs().

ROW.DATA: chips_circle, chips_cross, chips_diamond, chips_none, chips_plus, chips_square, chips_point_type, chips_uptriangle, chips_downtriangle
chips_solid, chips_dot, chips_noline, chips_longdash, chips_shortdash, chips_dotlongdash, chips_dotshortdash, chips_shortdashlongdash

DESC.PARA: The preferences are set so that the x axis should be drawn using log scaling and no line is drawn at y=0. Setting the get_resid_prof_prefs values only affects plots made after the change; to change an existing plot you need to use ChIPS commands such as log_scale() and linear_scale().
